location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.199 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: In the letter Hennell reports of a letter received by him from the Sultan of Muscat Thuwaini bin Said (a translation of which is enclosed in the letter), in which the Sultan explains his conduct with regard to the incarceration and death of Said Hamood bin Azan of Suhar. Hennell writes that he fears the feud between Muscat and Suhar might now be 'inextinguishable', and could lead to serious consequences in the Imam's inland territories.
